devdoc.author: Hourglass
devdoc.details: This vault is a KYC-enabled vault that generates yield for KYC users only. Phase-by-phase logic: 1. Deposit Phase:    - Users receive shares at a 1:1 ratio 2. KYC Phase:    - Admin can mark users as KYC approved during the KYC phase    - Non-KYC users can recover their USDC at a 1:1 ratio 3. Yield Phase:    - Treasury can withdraw KYC-approved USDC to treasury address    - Non-KYC users can recover their USDC at a 1:1 ratio 4. Withdraw Phase:    - KYC users can withdraw pro-rata USDT via the bridge contract    - Non-KYC users can recover their USDC at a 1:1 ratio 5. Recovery Phase:    - After RECOVERY_TIMESTAMP, anyone can transition to Recovery mode    - Non-KYC users recover their USDC at a 1:1 ratio    - KYC users recover their USDT at a pro-rata ratio plus any undeployed USDC pro-rata Accounting State: - All deposited USDC is initially non-KYC - When a user is marked KYC, their USDC moves from non-KYC pool to KYC pool - Deployable assets are USDC in the KYC pool - Non-KYC recoveries pull from the non-KYC USDC pool - KYC recoveries pull from the USDT balance and undeployed USDC

AccessControlBadConfirmation().details: The caller of a function is not the expected one. NOTE: Don't confuse with {AccessControlUnauthorizedAccount}.

DepositExceedsCap().details: This error is not used within this contract and is intended for use in      child contracts when validating deposits.

ECDSAInvalidSignatureLength(uint256).details: The signature has an invalid length.

ECDSAInvalidSignatureS(bytes32).details: The signature has an S value that is in the upper half order.

ERC20InsufficientAllowance(address,uint2.details: Indicates a failure with the `spender`’s `allowance`. Used in transfers.

params.allowance: Amount of tokens a `spender` is allowed to operate with.
params.needed: Minimum amount required to perform a transfer.
params.spender: Address that may be allowed to operate on tokens without being their owner.

ERC20InsufficientBalance(address,uint256.details: Indicates an error related to the current `balance` of a `sender`. Used in transfers.

params.balance: Current balance for the interacting account.
params.needed: Minimum amount required to perform a transfer.
params.sender: Address whose tokens are being transferred.

ERC20InvalidApprover(address).details: Indicates a failure with the `approver` of a token to be approved. Used in approvals.

ERC20InvalidReceiver(address).details: Indicates a failure with the token `receiver`. Used in transfers.

params.receiver: Address to which tokens are being transferred.

ERC20InvalidSender(address).details: Indicates a failure with the token `sender`. Used in transfers.

params.sender: Address whose tokens are being transferred.

ERC20InvalidSpender(address).details: Indicates a failure with the `spender` to be approved. Used in approvals.

params.spender: Address that may be allowed to operate on tokens without being their owner.

InvalidAccountNonce(address,uint256).details: The nonce used for an `account` is not the expected current nonce.

SafeERC20FailedOperation(address).details: An operation with an ERC-20 token failed.

Approval(address,address,uint256).details: Emitted when the allowance of a `spender` for an `owner` is set by a call to {approve}. `value` is the new allowance.

params.bridge: Address of the new bridge contract

params.owner: The address that will own the shares

params.cap: New maximum total deposits allowed in the vault

EIP712DomainChanged().details: MAY be emitted to signal that the domain could have changed.

params.owner: The owner of the shares being redeemed

RoleAdminChanged(bytes32,bytes32,bytes32.details: Emitted when `newAdminRole` is set as ``role``'s admin role, replacing `previousAdminRole` `DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE` is the starting admin for all roles, despite {RoleAdminChanged} not being emitted to signal this.

RoleGranted(bytes32,address,address).details: Emitted when `account` is granted `role`. `sender` is the account that originated the contract call. This account bears the admin role (for the granted role). Expected in cases where the role was granted using the internal {AccessControl-_grantRole}.

RoleRevoked(bytes32,address,address).details: Emitted when `account` is revoked `role`. `sender` is the account that originated the contract call:   - if using `revokeRole`, it is the admin role bearer   - if using `renounceRole`, it is the role bearer (i.e. `account`)

Transfer(address,address,uint256).details: Emitted when `value` tokens are moved from one account (`from`) to another (`to`). Note that `value` may be zero.

params.treasury: Address of the newly authorized treasury

DOMAIN_SEPARATOR().details: Returns the domain separator used in the encoding of the signature for {permit}, as defined by {EIP712}.

allowance(address,address).details: Returns the remaining number of tokens that `spender` will be allowed to spend on behalf of `owner` through {transferFrom}. This is zero by default. This value changes when {approve} or {transferFrom} are called.

approve(address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-approve}. NOTE: If `value` is the maximum `uint256`, the allowance is not updated on `transferFrom`. This is semantically equivalent to an infinite approval. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address.

balanceOf(address).details: Returns the value of tokens owned by `account`.

batchSetKycStatus(address[],bool).details: Reverts if batch is empty or exceeds MAX_BATCH_SIZE

returns._0: The address of the bridge contract

constructor.details: Bridge contract for withdrawals set later to avoid circular dependency.      Sets RECOVERY_TIMESTAMP to 180 days from deployment.      Grants DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE, ADMIN_ROLE, and TREASURY_ROLE to _admin.

params._admin: Address to receive all administrative roles
params._depositCap: The initial deposit cap for USDC deposits
params._treasuryAddress: Address of the treasury for yield deployment

returns._0: decimals The number of decimals (6, same as USDC and USDT)

deposit(uint256,address).details: Follows ERC4626-style pattern: check → preview → execute.      Shares are minted at 1:1 ratio to prevent inflation attacks.      Deposits are subject to the configured deposit cap.

returns._0: Current maximum total deposits allowed in the vault

eip712Domain().details: returns the fields and values that describe the domain separator used by this contract for EIP-712 signature.

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleGranted} event.

returns.maxAssets: Maximum USDC that can be deposited

name().details: Returns the name of the token.

nonces(address).details: Returns the current nonce for `owner`. This value must be included whenever a signature is generated for {permit}. Every successful call to {permit} increases ``owner``'s nonce by one. This prevents a signature from being used multiple times.

returns._0: The current operational mode of the vault

permit(address,address,uint256,uint256,u.details: Sets `value` as the allowance of `spender` over ``owner``'s tokens, given ``owner``'s signed approval. IMPORTANT: The same issues {IERC20-approve} has related to transaction ordering also apply here. Emits an {Approval} event. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address. - `deadline` must be a timestamp in the future. - `v`, `r` and `s` must be a valid `secp256k1` signature from `owner` over the EIP712-formatted function arguments. - the signature must use ``owner``'s current nonce (see {nonces}). For more information on the signature format, see the https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-2612#specification[relevant EIP section]. CAUTION: See Security Considerations above.

previewRedeemBridge(uint256).details: Implements IBridgeableVault interfaceUses the KYC-specific previewRedeem with msg.sender for compatibility

params.shares: Amount of shares to preview redemption for

returns.assets: Amount of USDT that would be received

recoverErc20(address,address).details: Only recovers excess tokens beyond what users can claim.      Protects sharesNonKyc USDC for non-KYC users.      Protects usdcKycDeployable USDC for KYC users.      Protects all USDT as it belongs to KYC users.

params.token: Address of the ERC20 token to recover

redeemBridge(uint256,address,address).details: Implements IBridgeableVault interface for bridge withdrawalsCan only be called in Withdraw mode by authorized bridge contractKYC users receive pro-rata share of USDT based on their share ownership

params.owner: Address that owns the shares being redeemed
params.receiver: Address to receive the redeemed assets
params.shares: Amount of vault shares to redeem

returns.usdtOut: Amount of USDT returned to the receiver

redeemNonKyc(uint256,address,address).details: Available in any phase (including Deposit) - non-KYC funds are always protected.      Non-KYC users maintain 1:1 redemption rate throughout all phases.      This ensures principal preservation for users who don't complete KYC.

params.owner: Owner of the shares being redeemed

redeemRecoveryKyc(uint256,address,addres.details: Can only be called in Recovery mode by KYC approved users.      Returns pro-rata share of both USDT and any undeployed USDC.      Non-KYC users should use redeemNonKyc() which works in any phase.      This function ensures KYC users can recover all assets in emergency scenarios,      including both yield-bearing USDT and any USDC not yet deployed.

params.owner: Owner of the shares being redeemed

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `callerConfirmation`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

setBridgeContract(address).details: Also marks the bridge as KYC-approved to allow it to redeem shares

params.newBridgeContract: Address of the bridge contract that can call withdraw

params.newCap: New maximum total USDT allowed (must be > 0 and >= current deposits)

supportsInterface(bytes4).details: Returns true if this contract implements the interface defined by `interfaceId`. See the corresponding https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-165#how-interfaces-are-identified[ERC section] to learn more about how these ids are created. This function call must use less than 30 000 gas.

symbol().details: Returns the symbol of the token, usually a shorter version of the name.

totalSupply().details: Returns the value of tokens in existence.

transfer(address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-transfer}. Requirements: - `to` cannot be the zero address. - the caller must have a balance of at least `value`.

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-transferFrom}. Skips emitting an {Approval} event indicating an allowance update. This is not required by the ERC. See {xref-ERC20-_approve-address-address-uint256-bool-}[_approve]. NOTE: Does not update the allowance if the current allowance is the maximum `uint256`. Requirements: - `from` and `to` cannot be the zero address. - `from` must have a balance of at least `value`. - the caller must have allowance for ``from``'s tokens of at least `value`.

transferToTreasury(uint256).details: Treasury can only access KYC pool funds, not non-KYC assets.      Reduces usdcKycDeployable to track deployed funds.      Ensures non-KYC user funds remain untouched and recoverable.

params.amount: Amount of USDC to transfer to treasury for yield generation

transitionToKycMode().details: Only callable by admin role when in Deposit mode.      After transition, no new deposits are accepted.

transitionToRecoveryMode().details: Must be past the recovery timestamp. Can be called permissionlessly.      Recovery mode is a terminal state that cannot be exited.      Provides emergency exit for all users if admin is compromised.      Non-KYC users recover USDC at 1:1, KYC users recover USDT + undeployed USDC.

transitionToWithdrawMode().details: Called after yield generation is complete and USDT has been returned.      Only callable by admin role when in Yield mode.      Treasury should have returned USDT before this transition.      After transition, KYC users can withdraw via bridge.

transitionToYieldMode().details: Called after KYC verification is complete.      Only callable by admin role when in Kyc mode.      After transition, treasury can withdraw KYC-approved funds.

returns._0: The address of the authorized treasury

_mode.details: Starts in Deposit mode and transitions through phases

sharesKyc.details: Increases when users are marked as KYC approved

sharesNonKyc.details: Decreases when users are marked as KYC approved

usdcKycDeployable.details: Decreases when treasury withdraws for yield generation

devdoc.title: HourglassStableVaultKYC

BatchTooLarge(uint256,uint256).notice: Thrown when batch size exceeds maximum allowed

BridgeNotSet().notice: Thrown when bridge-only function is called but bridge is not set

CallerIsNotBridge().notice: Thrown when a non-bridge caller attempts to execute a bridge-only function

DepositExceedsCap().notice: Thrown when a deposit would exceed the configured deposit cap

DepositWindowNotEnded().notice: Thrown when operation requires window to have ended, but it is not

DepositWindowNotOpen().notice: Thrown when operation requires window to be open, but it is not

EmptyBatch().notice: Thrown when batch array is empty

InsufficientBalance().notice: Thrown when attempting an operation without sufficient balance

InsufficientFundsForDeployment().notice: Thrown when there are insufficient funds for deployment to treasury

InvalidBridgeAddress().notice: Thrown when attempting to set a bridge address to the zero address

InvalidDepositCap().notice: Thrown when attempting to set an invalid deposit cap

InvalidOperationalMode(uint8,uint8).notice: Thrown when vault is not in the expected operational mode

InvalidTreasuryAddress().notice: Thrown when attempting to set a treasury address to the zero address

NoSharesFound().notice: Thrown when user has no shares

RecoverZeroAmount().notice: Thrown when attempting to recover zero amount of tokens or ETH

RecoveryForbidden(address).notice: Thrown when attempting to recover forbidden token

TransfersDisabled().notice: Thrown when attempting to transfer shares outside of allowed conditions

TransitionToRecoveryFailed().notice: Thrown when trying to transition to Recovery mode before the recovery timestamp

TreasuryNotSet().notice: Thrown when an operation requires treasury to be set but it is not

WindowCannotBeSet().notice: Thrown when attempting to modify a deposit window that cannot be changed

WindowInvalid().notice: Thrown when window parameters are invalid

ZeroAddress().notice: Thrown when an address parameter is zero but must be non-zero

ZeroAmount().notice: Thrown when an amount parameter is zero but must be non-zero

BridgeContractSet(address).notice: Emitted when the bridge contract address is updated

DepositCapSet(uint256).notice: Emitted when the deposit cap is updated

DepositWindowSet(uint64,uint64).notice: Emitted when a deposit window is configured or updated

KYCRecovery(address,uint256,uint256,uint.notice: Emitted when KYC user recovers both USDT and undeployed USDC in recovery mode

KYCRedeem(address,address,address,uint25.notice: Emitted when KYC user recovers USDT in withdrawal mode

NonKYCRecovery(address,uint256,uint256).notice: Emitted when non-KYC user recovers their funds

OperationalModeChanged(uint8,uint8).notice: Emitted when the operational mode changes

RecoveredERC20(address,address,uint256).notice: Emitted when ERC20 tokens are recovered from the contract

TreasuryAddressSet(address).notice: Emitted when the treasury address is set or updated

MAX_KYC_BATCH_SIZE().notice: Maximum number of users that can be processed in a single batch operation

RECOVERY_TIMESTAMP().notice: Timestamp after which the vault can enter Recovery mode permissionlessly

USDC().notice: USDC token contract address on Ethereum mainnet

USDT().notice: USDT token contract address on Ethereum mainnet

batchSetKycStatus(address[],bool).notice: Batch set KYC status for multiple users

bridgeContract().notice: Returns the current bridge contract address

decimals().notice: Returns the decimals of the vault shares

deposit(uint256,address).notice: Deposits USDC and mints shares for non-KYC users

depositEnd().notice: Returns the deposit window end timestamp

depositStart().notice: Returns the deposit window start timestamp

depositWindow().notice: Returns the complete deposit window parameters

maxDeposit().notice: Maximum amount of USDC that can be deposited

modifyPendingDepositWindow(uint64,uint64.notice: Modifies a deposit window that is pending (has not yet started)

modifyStartedDepositWindow(uint64).notice: Modifies the end timestamp of a deposit window that has already started

operationalMode().notice: Returns the current operational mode of the vault

previewRedeemBridge(uint256).notice: Preview the amount of assets that would be received for bridge redemption

recoverErc20(address,address).notice: Recovers mistakenly sent ERC20 tokens from the contract

redeemBridge(uint256,address,address).notice: Redeems vault shares for underlying assets for bridge operations

redeemNonKyc(uint256,address,address).notice: Allows non-KYC users to redeem shares for USDC at 1:1 ratio

redeemRecoveryKyc(uint256,address,addres.notice: Allows KYC users to redeem shares for both USDT and undeployed USDC in Recovery mode

setBridgeContract(address).notice: Sets the authorized bridge contract address and marks it as KYC-approved

setDepositCap(uint256).notice: Updates the deposit cap for the vault

setTreasuryAddress(address).notice: Sets the treasury address where funds are sent

sharesKyc().notice: Total shares held by KYC-approved users

sharesNonKyc().notice: Total shares held by non-KYC users

transferToTreasury(uint256).notice: Allows treasury to transfer USDC funds during Yield phase

transitionToKycMode().notice: Transitions the vault from Deposit to Kyc mode

transitionToRecoveryMode().notice: Transitions the vault from any state to Recovery mode (a terminal state)

transitionToWithdrawMode().notice: Transitions the vault from Yield to Withdraw mode

transitionToYieldMode().notice: Transitions the vault from KYC to Yield mode

treasuryAddress().notice: Returns the currently authorized treasury address

usdcKycDeployable().notice: Total USDC assets available for deployment from KYC pool

userdoc.notice: ERC20 pre-deposit vault with KYC for Stable. Accepts USDC deposits, deploys to treasury for yield generation
